subject: The Meereenese Knot...
event:
... may be fraying, just a little.

But don't quote me on that.

comments.article: Keep it up, George. We're all behind you.
Good luck, sir!
Hopeful is always a good mood to be in. Keep up the good work!
Oh yeah. Burn through that knot... with dragonfire.
Hopefully one good tug and it'll all come unraveled. Keep up the good work!
comments.subject: Woohoo!

comments.article: when the book comes out, I hope you tell us what the knot was... it may not be obvious in the final product.
comments.subject: knot...

comments.article: I'll hazard a guess it will involve sequences set in Meereen ;-)
comments.subject: Re: knot...

comments.article: Tiny rivulets carve mighty canyons, given time.  Keep on eroding away, sir!  I look forward to standing on the edge of a beautiful gorge one day.
Off topic, but that was wonderfully poetic.

comments.upictitle: Mopsa, Alycat, quite a few others..too many even: Angel
comments.article: Good luck to you, sir. =)

comments.upictitle: Brother Flaming Shuriken of Acceptance: Dangerous Thoughts (Iconomicon)
comments.article: Even if I'm all mysterious about it?
;DDDDD
Keep going! ♥
I've probably checked this page about a hundred times in the last three days.  Those 16 words were totally worth it.  Best of luck, and thanks as always for the update!

I wonders if the play is on words.  Is there a Fray in the knot, or is there a Frey in the knot?  After re-reading Feist methinks the Ironborn are the cause of the knot and not the Freys.  So, instead of a Fray perhaps it's a Steel knot which would require a torch...would a dragon do?
Work it, George, work it! ;-D
Your icon is AWESOME!! :D

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: Yay!
You need a Maniac McGee.
Nice!

... starts to drive us mad, too. Maybe you should integrate a nod to this famous knod ;-). I'm sure that a famous Alexander-like hero of Valyria's ancient past once traveled to Meereen to untie this precious knot of theirs. And with dragons the real Gordian knot would have been even easier to untie, I presume.
comments.subject: This knot...

comments.article: Ding! For The Alexander The Great Reference! Dang it, a year ago I was 50 KM away from the actual site where it happened! But enough about me-Go George!
comments.subject: Re: This knot...

comments.article: Sometimes it's a game of inches.

Every time you mention the Meereenese Knot, I cannot help but imagine you in an armchair surrounded by knitting needles and fighting an angry kitten over a tangled mess of yarn.

That is all. As you were.
ilu

comments.upictitle: More fun than a pair of pants full of geckos.: pic#7145910
comments.article: Work it man!  Yeah!

comments.upictitle: and things we're all too young to know: billy/penny
comments.article:
Know that you do not toil alone today, sir- I've gotten four thousand good words today, and hope to have twice that many tomorrow.

From the bottom of my heart, I wish you good luck.
You know, a good sharp sword can cut through just about any knot.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: furries
comments.article: Keep at it, good man. :)
Take the Alexanderian approach and hack through that knot with a Valyrian sword!
He tried that some time ago, but the sword bounced back and hit his nose. Must be woven from Shelob-style cobwebs. ;)
